location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Gulf of Persia, Bushire to Major George Willock, Secretary in Charge of the British Mission, Tabrize [Tabriz]

mods.abstract: The letter is informing Major Willock that Ephraim Gerrish Stannus has arrived at Bushire, and taken charge of the Bushire Residency.It further reports on his visit to Muscat en route to Bushire. It explains that as a result of his visit, he considers it extremely unlikely that Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, will provide assistance to any expedition the Persians may launch against Bahrain; the Resident now considers it unlikely that the Persians will attack Bahrain at all.It further reports that the Shaikh of Bushire, who was at Muscat at the time, was entirely occupied with securing a retreat in case he should incur the displeasure of the Government of Shiraz, regardless of what his official instructions actually were.
